name: AA Amwaj Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband Paul and I spent our silver wedding anniversary at this hotel, and it could not have been any more memorable, for all the right reasons. Our room was bigger than the ground floor or our little house, so I nearly got lost on several occasions! And I know it was cleaned on a daily basis, because I tested the theory!! In fact, the staff are cleaning 24/7, all over the hotel. I was fearful of sitting in one place for too long, in case they washed,mopped etc me!! The main restaurant always offered something for even the most fussy eater(Paul), and as for for dirty tables etc, either choose your time to eat away from the masses, or do a Sharon. That is, pick a spare table, slap your handbag on it, and stand there looking pathetic! The waiting staff sort it really quickly! We did manage to get into the bbq restaurant one one occasion,but they seem to be a little over subscribed by some clients. However, the main restaurant did a bbq on several occasions.We did not bother with the others, Mr fussy again. The pool area is fabulous! And the staff here are so professional! How Rammy, the main barman kept his cool with some clients is beyond me!!( personally, had someone talked to me the way I witnessed a Russian talk AT Rammy,I would have ripped his head off, and done something disgusting down his neck!!). The atrium bar is the focal point of the hotel for many.,and is subsequently busy at times. However, the staff here are again ultimately professional. The 24 hour service is very welcome after a hard days sight seeing in Cairo!! Thanks also has to go to duty manager Ahmed,Not only for conspiring with Paul, to make our special day memorable,but making sure our whole stay was perfect! Finally, to those who have written negative reviews,. Are you sure you stayed here?? Not sorry for refusing to join the "sit on sunbed and see what I can complain about next?" club!!! In fact, within 24 hours of our return home, Paul booked for next year!!!
reviews.title: We loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Some people on here really do need to get a life. Its pretty pathetic when all (you's) do is complain what is the point of going on holiday in the first place. You should stay at home you sad freaks and let people enjoy there holiday.
reviews.title: Some people just need to gat a life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most people don't even get to go holiday and the ones that do save, like to go away to enjoy there time. I bet you's can't wait to get home to put a review in trip advisor.
reviews.title: A realistic view - The Truth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm sorry but you's are sad people who need to stay at home and stop boring people like us on holiday.
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pete C
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel! Ignore negative reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have recently returned from staying at the Amwaj Hotel and would high recommend this hotel to solo, family and disabled travellers. My mother in law has additional needs and is unable to walk therefore, uses a wheelchair to access services.
reviews.title: A holiday of a lifetime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our stay all staff working at this complex insured all obstacles were overcome, which enabled her to access all services offered by this hotel, even to accessing their pool facilities, which she has not been able to access within other hotels within this resort.
reviews.title: Bad reviews are not constructive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greatly impressed by the professionalism of all staff working at this hotel and were very impressed to learn that Management have recently employed a Quality and Control manager (Stephanie) who originates from the UK. Stephanie has gained vast experience working within the Leisure and Tourism Industry worldwide and her experience is an asset to the hotel when dealing with any queries on a day to day basis.
reviews.title: Forgetful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can not thank all staff enough for their time, patience and kindness they showed during our stay and look forward to booking our next holiday at this hotel in the near future.
reviews.title: its not all its cracked up to be!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I have just returned from a 2 week stay at the AA Amwaj Hotel and Resort. We arrived very late evening after a 2½ hour delay from Manchester and a degree of chaos at Sharm-el-Sheikh airport, predominantly brought about by MTS (our Egyptian travel representatives). We were greeted well on arrival at the resort and were shown promptly and painlessly to our room. We made our way to the Atrium bar at about 1-30 am and were able to chill out with drinks well into the early hours (so-be-it with small beer glasses).
reviews.title: Please believe the bad reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just got back from a week with my 7 month old son, 3 year old daughter, husband and mother in law. Originally booked Sunrise Tirana Aquapark with Quickrooms.com but they messed me about for 5 weeks before we travelled and we ended up with this hotel, rather reluctantly.
reviews.title: Could be Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Pros - only a few
reviews.title: Solo traveller at Amwaj Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large rooms with massive king size bed with pool view on ground floor, was great to take kids outta hot sunshine and still be able to sit outside room catchin some rays - 30 second walk to bar to keep refilling the plastic thimbles (not so much a pro).
reviews.title: Super Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Swimming pool is fantastic, very large freeform pool with a few separate areas with kids pool, swim up pool bar and plenty of loungers around pool and not too crowed - plenty of parasols. Made a change from Europe when you have to be up at 6.00 am to get yourself a good spot and manage to get a towel on the bed!!
reviews.title: Relaxed and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons - very big ones!!
reviews.title: FANTASTIC STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read quite a view conflicting reviews about this hotel before I booked, mainly about the food, but decided to try it. Neither myself nor my partner were disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for a relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely from the outside and the lobby was beautiful. We were checked in very quickly and a 'bellboy' took our bags to our room. The room itself was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The bathroom could definitely do with a bit of an update as was a bit marked and the sealant was discoloured but the room was cleaned daily and the shower was good. For the lowest priced room from our travel agent we were very pleased.
reviews.title: good people let down by poor food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food-wise we were happy. There's always fresh pasta and chips on the terrace if you don't fancy anything from the main restaurant but we always found something to eat. It can be quite chaotic on the first day but just find a table (if it's not laid up a waiter will come and do it quite soon), get drinks from the bar and the back and then help yourself to food. Waiters will get you drinks if you ask and if you then tip them. The food is 'international' so will not suit all tastes all the time but what we tried was cooked very well. Breakfast was best for me as there were pancakes and waffles every morning. We tried the Italian one night which was good but we found the waiter service a bit uncomfortable, plus you have to book and there is a line every morning for this from about 8:50am. We were lazy and just wanted to eat exactly when we wanted so we stuck with the main restaurant.
reviews.title: brill time , great staff ,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The pool area is gorgeous with the most comfortable loungers. People do reserve loungers with their towels but they don't get up at crazy times to do it - mainly before breakfast - and if you don't bother then you'll always find some free. The pool staff will find loungers for you and take them to wherever you want to lounge but you will need to tip. Didn't lounge on the beach but it was peaceful when we walked past. The shallows are amazing and filled with starfish which I loved and there's a private jetty. Definitely bring or buy some snorkling gear as the fish are beautiful and the water is crystal clear. You will need swimming shoes though as the coral is sharp.
reviews.title: Good Quality Hotel - excellent location, great beach and nice pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couple of things to be aware of: a) the shops are very expensive at the hotel - walk down the drive, through the gates and turn left for a mini-market or cross the road for souvenir shopping; b) the staff are strict about the times the all-inclusive for drinks start so don't even try! Plus, drinks will usually come in quite small glasses or cups so if you want a larger drink think about bringing your own glass (as one guy we saw had, and was therefore the only guy with a pint!); c) the beds in our room (inland view standard) were two queen-size beds which we just pushed together. The staff then cleaning your room will make them up as one big bed when they're together; d) people will come by several times a day offering you excursions or treatments in the spa. Be friendly and polite and they won't press you to buy - a good line is to say you've booked the excursions you want with your rep.
reviews.title: farkas family //fantastic.

description: Amwaj Hotel & Resort – is a 5 star luxurious Hotel & Resort, located on a sprawling 400 meters long private sandy beach that is, offering comfortable accommodation and leisure facilities with fascinating rooms and suites, all boasting magnificent sea views. Our Resort features a selection of fine Restaurants and Bars, Swimming Pools, Beach, Shopping arcade, and well equipped Health Club & Spa.
